title.en: Master's Seminar in Robotics and Computer Engineering

description.en:
Seminary deals with robotics, computer equipment, aerospace and information technology applications in general or related to specific problems.

Detailed information about seminars is sent to it_seminar@lists.ut.ee mailing list. In order to join this mailing-list, go to http://lists.ut.ee/wws/info/it_seminar
description.et: Seminaris käsitletakse robootika, arvutitehnika, kosmose- ja infotehnoloogiliste rakendustega seonduvaid üldisi või spetsiifilisi probleeme. Seminaride info edastatakse listi it_seminar@lists.ut.ee NB! Ainele ÕIS-is registreerumine ei ole vajalik. Küll aga on oluline liituda postiloendiga it_seminar@lists.ut.ee, sest ainult seal toimub kogu ainega seonduv infovahetus. Postiloendiga liitumiseks tuleb minna aadressile: http://lists.ut.ee/wws/info/it_seminar

objectives.en: To introduce the students to the actual problems of robotics, computer engineering, space and information technology. Students have a chance to learn and improve their skills for making the presentations.
objectives.et: Tutvustada üliõpilastele robootika, arvutitehnika, kosmose- ja infotehnoloogia aktuaalseid probleeme. Luua tudengile tingimused õppimaks esitluste koostamist ja nende ettekandmist.

learning_outcomes.en: After passing this course, the student is able
1) to put together and give presentation in the field of robotics, computer engineering or space technology
learning_outcomes.et: 1) oskab koostada erialast ettekannet ning seda auditooriumi ees ette kanda.

learning_outcomes.en: 2) to give answers to the questions about the presentation
learning_outcomes.et: 2) on võimeline andma vastuseid ettekandega seonduvatele ootamatutele küsimustele.

notes.et: The current seminar information will be posted to the mailing list it_seminar@list.ut.ee. All the other information about the seminars, conditions and everything is on the course moodle page.

description.et: The single student presentation. Should correspond to the requirements of the standard presentation, including the discussion to the audience.

The group of students (upto 4 members) prepares a seminar on specific topic (preferably) in computer engineering or related field. It should involve single presentations form each member of the group. The presentations should be related to each other and correspond to the seminar topic. The discussion to audience has to be a part of the presentation.

grade_preconditions.et: Participate in 3 group presentations during your studies. The group consists of up to 4 members. The group is responsible for the content and the presentation of the seminar during its 1.5 hours. Every group member receives 2 ECTS for his/her activities during the seminar what the group is responsible of. Everybody has to participate once per semester during 3 semesters. The seminar topics are either given or freely selectable. All the members of the group should contribute as equal parts as possible. The topics will be posted in the course moodle page and sent to the course mailing list it_seminar@lists.ut.ee. If the member of the group does not participate in the group activities or is absent in the seminar the group is responsible of, then he/she will not receive the ECTS for that seminar. One does not have to participate in the same group for every single seminar. If there is a need for the single ECTS or a need to practice for an oncoming important presentation or the thesis defence, then upto 20-minute presentation is possible in the seminar of single presentations. The presenter receives then 1 ECTS. For more information, look at course moodle page.

grade_evaluation.et:
The course is passed if the following conditions are fulfilled:
(1) 6 ECTS from group and/or single presentations, considering 2 ECTS for group and 1 ECTS for single presentation
(2) participation of at least 75% of seminars during 3 semesters.

debt_elimination.et: Participation of the seminars during oncoming semester(s) under the standard conditions.
